Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor walked against Devin Williams in the 10-pitch, 1-2-3 ninth inning, setting off a chain of events that led to the Mets' victory.
Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer, giving the Mets the lead.
Starling Marte added an insurance RBI single.
Brice Turang made a one-hopper at Francisco Lindor, who fired to first for the out.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Cohen, the Mets owner, expressed renewed hope in the team's playoff chances.
David Stearns, the Mets president of baseball operations, praised Lindor's consistency throughout the season.
Brandon Nimmo highlighted Lindor's professionalism and the impact of his at-bat.
The Mets won their first playoff series since 2015, advancing to the Division Series against Philadelphia.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jesse Winker was the only batter to reach base against Williams after the 1-2 count.
The Mets' bullpen nearly cost them the season in May but was improved by changes made by Stearns.
